**The Supreme Compassionate Dao-Field Rite of the Water Repentance for the Extinction of Sins, Fascicle One**

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Origin resided in the Great Luo Heaven, upon the Purple Tenuity Terrace of the Jade Capital and Golden Tower. There, a grand assembly of immortals was convened, where the wondrous Dharma was expounded to deliver and enlighten both gods and humans, guiding them to awaken to the Dao without enduring manifold sufferings. Manifesting great majestic power and radiating boundless luminosity, the light illumined all ten thousand realms.

All sins and blessings stood plainly before them, profound and subtly wondrous. Through expedient means, all the destitute souls of the hells—enduring immeasurable agonies and inexpressible torments—were delivered, rescued from drowning in the depths, and universally liberated.

Then, the Merciful Honored One of the Origin, in boundless compassion, further expounded the essential Dao, bestowing benefits upon both past and future. Again, he addressed the perfected attendants at his side, saying:

"Humans receive life, all endowed with the same qi. Yet upon birth, their fate is bound to the Three Origins. Longevity or premature death, fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness—all arise from the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, good and evil, life and death. Each follows the root of their former existence, and all receive retribution according to their karmic deeds, never deviating, as the shadow follows the form or the echo responds to the valley.

On the Three Origin Days each year, the officials of the Three Origins, along with the deities of the Three Realms and the Ten Directions, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the spirits of good and evil, and all numinous officials ascend to the Golden Tower before the Primordial Celestial Worthy to examine the registers of life and death for men and women, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, and the ledgers of names and deeds of the destitute souls in the Nine Dark Hells, the Water Palaces, and other realms.

At this time, if there are faithful men and women who naturally awaken to the Dao, erecting Purple Tenuity Treasure Terraces, Jade Capital Treasure Mountains, pavilions and towers adorned with a hundred treasures, offering incense and flowers, burning incense and circumambulating, chanting cavernous scriptures, lighting lamps and releasing living beings, performing the *Step-of-Emptiness* rites, practicing almsgiving and making vows, repenting transgressions and submitting memorials, holding grand fasts and jiao offerings, and devoutly petitioning Heaven and Earth day and night without ceasing—then I shall dispatch the Celestial Worthies and Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions, the divine immortals of the Three Realms, the Four Controllers, and the Youths Who Save from Suffering to descend to the human realm, all arriving at the Dao-field to extinguish their sins and protect the living.

Thus shall the lands be peaceful, men and women joyous and at ease, all blessings descend, and all evils cease to arise. The suffering souls of hell shall be liberated in an instant, reborn in the heavens to enjoy boundless bliss, their merit towering and their blessings immeasurable."

The Merciful Honored One continued: "On the fifteenth day of the first month, the Celestial Official of the Upper Origin and the Recording Officials of the Hundred Bureaus ascend to the celestial palaces to present the registers of sin and blessing for the world’s people."

For this reason, the sponsor of this repentance rite now dedicates the merit, reverently prostrating to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Origin Heaven, taking refuge in the spirit, body, and life, and paying homage to the supremely merciful and compassionate Celestial Worthy beyond compare.

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Jade Purity Primordial Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Bestows Boundless Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Dispels Disasters and Resolves Calamities.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Prolongs Life and Increases Longevity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Preserves Life and Protects Destiny.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Purple Purity Celestial Worthy Who Descends Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Eight Trigrams Who Guards the Body.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Nine Palaces Who Defends Against Calamities.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Lofty Perfection and Wondrous Fruition.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Numinous Treasure Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions.

Having thus paid homage to the sacred titles of the Celestial Worthies above, we now repent:

From beginningless time until this day, for myself, my teachers, preceptors, parents, and the six relations, for all transgressions committed through the three karmic actions and the six senses—
Thus has the body craved softness and smoothness, the mind given rise to false imaginings, the eyes beheld evil forms, the ears listened to perverse sounds, the nose favored foul odors, the tongue coveted rich flavors, the heart harbored jealousy, and the mouth uttered defiled speech.
Such sins as these are boundless and immeasurable.
Today, with utmost sincerity, we earnestly repent them all.

Next, we dedicate the merit, reverently prostrating to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Origin Heaven, taking refuge in the spirit, body, and life, and paying homage to the supremely merciful and compassionate Celestial Worthy beyond compare.

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Azure Numinous Primordial Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Cinnabar Numinous Perfected Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Luminous August Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Five Numinous Mysterious Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Mysterious Numinous Primordial Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Solemn Purity and Dharma Wisdom.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Responsive Power and Might.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Fearless Brahmā-Form Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Ocean of Great Wisdom.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Boundless Dharma Treasury.

Having thus paid homage to the sacred titles of the Celestial Worthies above, we now repent:

From beginningless time until this day, for myself, my teachers, preceptors, parents, and the six relations, for the boundless and immeasurable sins of killing—
Whether slaughtering pigs, sheep, oxen, horses, chickens, dogs, geese, or ducks;
Or killing flying birds, running beasts, aquatic creatures, fish and scales, or all crawling beings endowed with life;
Or aiding the sick, engaging in licentious sacrifices to ghosts and spirits, and killing living beings;
Or hunting for sport, plowing fields and digging the earth, raising silkworms and boiling cocoons, setting fires or releasing waters, burning dung or sweeping the ground, and killing living beings;
Or drinking wine and eating meat;
Or making fermented sauces and pickled fish, burning firewood and lighting lamps, pouring boiling water on the ground, and killing living beings;
Or separating mothers from their young, cutting off their gestation;
Or killing embryos and eggs;
Or slaughtering living beings beyond count;
Or killing creditors, enemies, or good people from the four directions;
Or killing through contention, deceit, jealousy, plunder, or robbery;
Or killing through warfare, slander, or expedient means—
We earnestly repent all such sins.

Or employing heterodox teachings, burying names and driving nails into written characters, cursing to kill;
Or through official laws, wrongfully taking lives;
Or coveting others’ wealth and treasures, falsely accusing people to their deaths;
Or seizing others’ wives and children, contending for others’ husbands, leading to killing;
Or killing before Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the empty sky, temples, and shrines;
Or invoking ancestors to swear oaths, thereby causing killing;
Or in men’s marriages and women’s weddings, gatherings for fortune or misfortune, the birth of sons, the welcoming of relatives and friends, untimely revelry, indulging in lust and lewdness, sleeping among flowers and willows—
Countless killings ensue, filling the empty sky with grievance and resentment.
For all such sins of killing, boundless and measureless, today we earnestly and reverently repent.
Next, we dedicate this repentance to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Prime Heavenly Realm, taking refuge in the gods, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life, to the supremely compassionate and merciful Most High Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Myriad Virtues.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Mysterious Subtlety and Self-Mastery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Luminous Awareness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Harmony and Wondrous Treasure.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Upright Dignity and Mighty Power.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Illuminating Radiance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the Dharma Bridge and Great Deliverance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Vast Propagation and Life-Preservation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Revealing the Wondrous Gate.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Soul-Protection and Merciful Salvation.
From this point onward, we bow and recite the sacred names of the Heavenly Worthies.
We earnestly repent for all the sins of theft committed by myself, from beginningless time until today, by my seven ancestors and nine lineages, teachers and parents, both the living and the dead, and all my kin.
Or stealing images of the Heavenly Worthies, the Three Treasures, and various goods;
Or stealing from compassionate parents, various goods;
Or stealing from the rich and noble, the poor and lowly, various goods;
Or stealing from the nation’s treasuries, taxes and tributes, official money and goods;
Or stealing from wives and concubines, sons and daughters, the noble and the base, their goods.
For all such sins of theft, boundless and measureless, today we earnestly and reverently repent.
Next, we dedicate this repentance to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Prime Heavenly Realm, taking refuge in the gods, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life, to the supremely compassionate and merciful Most High Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Flowing Light and Dharma Joy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Majestic Sanctity and Transforming the Common.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Penetrating Spirit and Compassionate Regard.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Kindness and Karmic Completion.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Increasing Sagely Wisdom.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Merit-Adorned Purity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Perfection and Eternal Bliss.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Jeweled Radiance and Good Stillness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Phase-Light and Self-Mastery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Golden Perfection and Life-Deliverance.
From this point onward, we bow and recite the sacred names of the Heavenly Worthies.
We earnestly repent for all the sins of lust committed by myself, from beginningless time until today, by the living and the dead, and all my kin.
Or engaging in lustful acts beneath the empty sky, the sun, moon, and stars;
Or engaging in lustful acts near wells, stoves, doorways, shrines, temples, monasteries, and sacred sites;
Or committing incest with the six relations;
Or defiling flesh and blood;
Or violating monastics, deceiving the chaste, seizing and harming others, severing others’ bonds of love, engaging in lust;
Or disregarding age, defiling the confused and deluded, persisting in ignorance without repentance.
For all such sins of deviant lust and desire, boundless and measureless, today we earnestly and reverently repent.
Next, we dedicate this repentance to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Prime Heavenly Realm, taking refuge in the gods, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life, to the supremely compassionate and merciful Most High Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Emperor of the Clear Subtlety Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Emperor of the Yu-Yu Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Emperor of the Great Red Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Golden Kindness and Mysterious Penetration.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Compassion and Vast Salvation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Penetrating the Lofty Mystery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Longevity and Myriad Virtues.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of True Wandering in the Highest.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Dharma Flowing Far and Wide.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Lofty Virtue and Jeweled Treasury.
From this point onward, we bow and recite the sacred names of the Heavenly Worthies.
We earnestly repent for all the sins of offending the lofty perfected ones committed by myself, from beginningless time until today, by my seven ancestors and nine lineages, teachers and parents, both the living and the dead, and all my kin.
Or showing disrespect to the heavens above, the sun, moon, and stars;
Or failing to revere wind and rain, clouds and mist, thunder and lightning;
Or facing the Northern Dipper without avoiding the various heavens, exposing the naked body, relieving oneself, eating with disheveled hair, spitting and uttering filthy words, laughing, weeping, and engaging in all manner of improper conduct.
For all such sins of offense, boundless and measureless, today we earnestly and reverently repent.
Next, we dedicate this repentance to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Prime Heavenly Realm, taking refuge in the gods, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life, to the supremely compassionate and merciful Most High Heavenly Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Congealed Constancy and Life-Transformation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Mysterious Power and Fixed Vows.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Uniting the Perfected and Manifesting Presence.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Wondrous Completion and Perfect Conduct.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Dragon Virtue and Majestic Dignity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Lofty Mystery and Primordial Simplicity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Emperor of Numinous Perfection.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Golden Resources and Wondrous Form.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Revealing the Essential Pointer.

With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme Victory.
From this point onward, we recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We beseech forgiveness for the manifold karmic obstructions wrought by this body,
imploring the Boundless Dao, the Three Supreme Ones, the Five Venerable Elders,
the Ten August Sovereigns of Hua, the sun, moon, and stellar lodges,
the Jade Armillary and Celestial Balance, the Eighty-One Heavens,
the Thirty-Two Emperors, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
the Four Controllers and Three Realms, the Demon Kings and Flying Celestial Saints,
the future Perfected Administrators, the past True Officials—
with great compassion, universal salvation, grace to wash away transgressions,
blessings to dissolve enmities, cessation of bitterness in the Five Paths,
accumulation of fortune at the Three Primes,
fulfillment of merit and perfection of virtue,
that we may unite with the Dao and merge with the True.
May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao,
and may the Three Treasures of the Supreme Void Sovereign attest to their realization.

*End of the Upper Scroll of the Most High Compassionate Altar’s Water Repentance for the Extinction of Transgressions*
*Middle Scroll of the Most High Compassionate Altar’s Water Repentance for the Extinction of Transgressions*

At that time, the Compassionate Honored One spoke:
On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, the Earth Official of the Middle Prime
presides over the hundred bureaus, ascending to the heavenly courts
to present the records of mortals’ transgressions and blessings.
Today, the repentant patron [Name] thus dedicates this merit,
revering all the sagely and divine beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Clarity and Numinous Treasure.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Deliverance from the Nine Hells.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Lofty Illumination.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Empty Wisdom and Eternal Constancy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Expedient and Benevolent Salvation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Penetrating Truth and Responsive Manifestation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Bountiful Bestowal of All Goodness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Harmonious Radiance and Forbearance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Concentrated Spirit and Mystic Awareness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Revolving the Wheel and Enacting Movement.
From this point onward, we recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We beseech forgiveness for the sins of immeasurable stinginess, greed, attachment, and miserliness—
from the beginningless past until this day—
committed by our teachers, preceptors, parents, and living or deceased kin.
At times, witnessing others teaching and transforming, performing good deeds and establishing merit,
or seeing the poor, sick, and afflicted, we failed to relinquish or aid them with expedient means.
For these manifold sins of stinginess and greed, boundless and immeasurable,
today we devoutly seek repentance.
We further dedicate this merit to all the True and Sagely beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Selflessness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Transformative Subtle Illumination.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Penetration and Measured Capacity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Great Benevolence and All Goodness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Oceanic Magnanimity and Boundless Depth.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Prosperous Nations and Great Peace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Radiant Mystery and Lofty Clarity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Eternal Abiding in the Void’s Extremity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the Mystic Subtle and Virtuous Root.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Illuminating Spirit and Delivering Destiny.
From this point onward, we recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We beseech forgiveness for the boundless and immeasurable sins of wrath and anger—
from the beginningless past until this day—
committed by our teachers, preceptors, parents, and living or deceased kin.
At times, we raged against the Heavenly Worthies, scriptures, dharma, dharma masters, and Daoist priests.
At times, we raged against emperors, officials, parents, and blood kin.
At times, we raged against altars, dharma assemblies, and all meritorious deeds.
At times, we raged against yin and yang, wind, rain, cold, and heat.
At times, we raged against the empty sky, sun, moon, stellar lodges, and revered sages.
At times, we raged against upright ghosts and spirits, and the worthy sages of the past.
At times, we raged against spring, summer, autumn, and winter, day and night, long and short.
At times, we raged against scholars, farmers, artisans, merchants,
the widowed, orphaned, and solitary, prisoners, exiles, the poor, aged, sick, and infirm.
At times, we raged against friends, companions, wives, children, servants, and slaves.
At times, we raged against oxen, horses, and the six livestock,
birds, beasts, and all living beings.
For these manifold sins of wrath and anger, boundless and immeasurable,
today we devoutly seek repentance.
We further dedicate this merit to all the Sagely and Divine beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Gathering Goodness and Initiating the Teaching.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the Wondrous Empty and True Form.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Embracing Vastness and Measured Capacity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Wisdom’s Treasury and Subtle Penetration.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Benevolent Understanding and Empty Quiescence.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Illumination and Subtle Mystery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Dharma’s Emptiness and Void’s Concentration.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Heavenly Treasure and Self-Mastery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Equal and Benevolent Response.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Illuminating Radiance and Aiding Beings.
From this point onward, we recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We beseech forgiveness for the boundless and immeasurable sins of ignorance, delusion, and obstinate views—
from the beginningless past until this day—
committed by our six relations and kin, both living and deceased.
At times, we clung to ignorance and delusion in the presence of the Three Treasures.
At times, we clung to ignorance and delusion before emperors and officials.
At times, we clung to ignorance and delusion before parents and blood kin.
At times, we clung to ignorance and delusion in the presence of all beings and their dwellings.
For these manifold sins of ignorance and delusion, boundless and immeasurable,
today we devoutly seek repentance.
We further dedicate this merit to all the Sagely and Divine beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Pure Subtlety and Penetrating Awakening.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Great Illumination and Empty Realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Lofty Clarity and Wondrous Wisdom.

With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Salvation and Boundless Grace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Myriad Transformations and Radiant Light.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Purple Void and Mystic Sanctity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Soaring Wisdom and Sagely Flight.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Brahma-Treasure and Great Emptiness.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Spirit and Equal Vision.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Oceanic Void and Discerning Wisdom.

From the above, we have reverently recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We devoutly seek repentance for the boundless and immeasurable sins of frivolous speech and falsehood—committed from beginningless time until this day—before masters and teachers, parents and kin, and the six relations. At times, we spoke duplicitously, saying one thing to a person’s face and another behind their back. At times, we sowed discord by speaking of one to another, severing bonds of kinship and friendship. At times, we failed to reflect on our own faults, ignored the truth of matters, judged others’ right and wrong, spread rumors of their strengths and weaknesses, misunderstood righteousness, concealed goodness, and broadcast evil. We slandered emperors and parents, belittled masters and elders, undermined the loyal and good, suppressed those superior to ourselves, praised depraved teachings, and reviled the true Dao. For these manifold sins of frivolous speech, falsehood, and divisive words, boundless and immeasurable,
today we devoutly seek repentance.
We further dedicate this merit to all the Sagely and Divine beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme and Wondrous Fruit.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Universal Karmic Causes and Good Wishes.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Subtle Might and Majestic Virtue.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Protection and Salvation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Upright Conduct and Brahma-Purity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Perfecting Goodness and Pristine Clarity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Immortal Spirits and Righteous Practice.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Bestowal and Goodness-Inspiring.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Inconceivable Might and Power.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Responsive Transformation and Karmic Attunement.

From the above, we have reverently recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We devoutly seek repentance for the boundless and immeasurable sins of cursing and reviling—committed from beginningless time until this day—before masters and teachers, parents, the six relations, and all kin. At times, we cursed the Heavenly Worthies and the Great Dao. At times, we cursed the sutras, the Dharma, and the Dharma-teachers. At times, we cursed emperors and officials. At times, we cursed spiritual friends and companions. At times, we cursed wives, concubines, sons, and daughters. At times, we cursed the six relations and all kin. At times, we cursed those with incomplete faculties, the six afflictions, and the hundred diseases. At times, we cursed the poor, the aged, the young, the widowed, the orphaned, the childless, servants, and the lowly. At times, we cursed Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the stars, wind and rain, clouds and mist, rainbows and halos, thunder and lightning. At times, we cursed the length of day and night, the cold of winter and heat of summer, the four seasons and eight solar terms, frost, snow, and the cycles of qi. At times, we cursed upright spirits, locusts, floods, and droughts. At times, we cursed the five grains, the hundred fruits, silk, hemp, cloth, and silk fabrics. At times, we cursed oxen, horses, the six livestock, flying birds, running beasts, and all creeping creatures. At times, we imprisoned the innocent, bound the foolish, and oppressed the good. For these manifold sins of coarse words, invoking Heaven and Earth, summoning spirits, and reviling—boundless and immeasurable,
today we devoutly seek repentance.
We further dedicate this merit to all the Sagely and Divine beings of the Middle Prime’s earthly realm.

With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Fragrant Forests and Meditative Contemplation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Effortless Universal Salvation.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Life-Preserving and Ascendant Birth.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Unobstructed Supreme Virtue.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Impartial Salvation from Suffering.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Sagely Exposition and Primordial Opening.

With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Jeweled Summit and Great Perfection.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Utmost Truth and Profound Stillness.

From the above, we have reverently recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.
We devoutly seek repentance for the manifold sins and karmic offenses within this body.
We humbly beseech the Ninefold Clarity and Three Caverns’ Compassionate Worthies, the Five Elders and Ten Flowers of the Great Dao, the August Lord of Heaven, the ranks of lofty perfected beings, the Nine Emperorial Immortals, the Ten Palaces’ True Lords, the Three Primordials’ Great Emperors, the Sacred Peaks of the Five Marchmounts, the blessed lands and grotto-heavens, Mount Fengdu and the Five Sacred Peaks, the Four Bureaus’ officials, the Nine Courts’ assembled ranks, the host of transcendent immortals, and the multitude of sages within the alchemical crucible: may your vast grace universally suffuse, your beneficent blessings overflow, release us from worldly transgressions, dispel our mundane afflictions, take pity on all beings, deliver the suffering in darkness, and in life after life, may all ascend to the Great Dao.

The *Water Repentance for the Elimination of Sins in the Merciful Altar of the Most High* concludes here.
The *Water Repentance for the Elimination of Sins in the Merciful Altar of the Most High*, Scroll the Lower.

At that time, the Compassionate Worthy declared: On the fifteenth day of the tenth month, the Water Official of the Lower Prime, overseeing the hundred bureaus, ascends to the celestial palace to present the ledgers of the world’s sins and blessings.
For this reason, the sponsor of this repentance rite dedicates this merit to all the Immortal and Sagely beings of the Lower Prime’s watery realm.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Clarity and the Dao and its Virtue.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Ever-Present and Constant Appearance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Wondrous Protection and Supreme Perfection.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Returning Spirits and Reviving the Dead.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Majestic Authority and Self-Mastery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Peaceful Stabilization and All Sentient Beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Longevity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Constant Goodness and Salvation of Beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of All-Embracing Virtue and Transformative Power.
With utmost sincerity, we bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of Engendering the Myriad Beings.

From this point onward, we recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies in worship. We beseech forgiveness for all sins—from beginningless time until this very day—committed by ourselves, our masters and teachers, our parents, our six relations, and our boundless kin, which have obstructed the human realm in countless ways.

Moreover, in the course of trade and commerce, whether as traveling merchants or settled traders, in buying and selling goods, in transactions at inns and markets, in measures of volume and weight—scales, bushels, ounces, and grains—there may have been additions or subtractions, deceptions or concealments from others. Perhaps we exchanged the coarse for the fine, the short for the long, defrauded others in calculations, breached walls to steal, or committed robbery and theft. Perhaps we blocked roads, denied debts, or lent capital at exorbitant interest. Perhaps we feigned false skills to swindle others of their wealth, or envied the intelligence, wealth, or status of others, abusing official power to slander them. Perhaps we secretly set traps or shot arrows, offending the divine. Perhaps we consumed wine and meat, the five pungent vegetables, or the three forbidden foods, defiling sacred merit. Perhaps, as officials or clerks, we administered justice unfairly. Perhaps, in high position, we were irreverent, or in low station, disrespectful—lacking rank in the court or standing in the community.

Such boundless and measureless transgressions as these I now devoutly confess and repent in their entirety. Next, I dedicate this merit to all the immortals and sages of the Lower Primordial Water Realm, taking refuge in the divine, taking refuge in the spirit, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life—O Most Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who expounds the Dao in primordial chaos.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose Dharma grace flows far and wide.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who attains sagehood through accumulated merit.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who concentrates spirit to illumine the realm.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who harmonizes spirit to benefit all beings.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who skillfully unravels the net of existence.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose merit and practice are perfectly fulfilled.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who repays merit with virtue.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who conceals traces to preserve the Dao.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy crowned with a floating canopy of purple radiance.

From this point onward, I reverently recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.

I beseech forgiveness for all my transgressions from beginningless time until this day—those committed against my parents, teachers, and preceptors, whether living or deceased, whether of the Daoist or secular realms, and all my kin. Perhaps I have lightly esteemed the Three Treasures, my devotion lacking constancy. Perhaps I have betrayed my teachers and preceptors, violating vows and breaking covenants. Perhaps I have been disloyal to my sovereign, unyielding to the times, failing to honor the Great Dao, or treating its teachings with contempt. Perhaps I have defiled rivers and streams, dredged the hundred waterways, taken fish and scales to satisfy my palate. Perhaps I have acted without shame or remorse, disdaining clothing and food, wasting the five grains, cursing oxen and horses, harming silkworms and moths, or neglecting agriculture and sericulture. Perhaps I have seen profit and forgotten righteousness, lacking integrity and honor, favoring the new while abandoning the old, or knowing kindness yet failing to repay it.

Such boundless and measureless transgressions as these I now devoutly confess and repent in their entirety. Next, I dedicate this merit to all the immortals and sages of the Lower Primordial Water Realm, taking refuge in the divine, taking refuge in the spirit, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life—O Most Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of unparalleled honor and wonder.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who bestows grace from the Jade Capital.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who saves through the treasure of adaptable power.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the radiant Brahma-light of the Great Tenuity.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose true form is perfectly fulfilled.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of supreme and unconditioned victory.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of tranquil harmony and pure joy.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of serene non-attainment.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the unfathomable dark source.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of silent contemplation and non-action.

From this point onward, I reverently recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.

I beseech forgiveness for all my transgressions from beginningless time until this day—those committed against the living and the dead, the Daoist and the secular, for failing to reflect on the toil and suffering of my parents, repaying none of their nurturing care: the ten months of pregnancy, three years of breastfeeding, turning dry for wet, swallowing bitterness to spit out sweetness, washing and tending, their boundless love and concern—only to commit the five heinous acts of filial impiety in return. Perhaps as son or daughter, for the sake of qi or wealth, I have indulged in wine and lust, entangled in enmity and curses, implicating my parents in endless resentment. Perhaps in building homes or graves, I have violated many taboos, filling the measure of my sins to overflowing, inviting calamity to flow forth. Perhaps my retribution has come through lawsuits and summons, my deceased ancestors drawn into the fray. Perhaps my fate has grown weak and perilous, malevolent stars traversing my path, manifesting in this life as various karmic flowers, while in hell, they ripen into various karmic fruits.

The Merciful Worthy declares: Such retributions for the body in this life all stem from sins committed in past lives. After death, one passes through hell, and in the next life, suffers retribution across the six paths, endlessly revolving in the wheel of rebirth.

Today, I devoutly confess and repent of all these transgressions in their entirety. Next, I dedicate this merit to all the immortals and sages of the Lower Primordial Water Realm, taking refuge in the divine, taking refuge in the spirit, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life—O Most Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose merit and deeds are boundless.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose Dharma rain pours abundantly.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of vast and perfect fulfillment.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who pities the suffering of all beings.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who concentrates the Dharma-treasury in emptiness.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy, the King of Non-Attainment and Grace.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who responds and transforms according to conditions.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who illumines the world with clarity.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who adapts to impermanence.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of vast compassion and magnanimity.

From this point onward, I reverently recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.

I beseech forgiveness for all my transgressions from beginningless time until this day.

Then the Merciful Worthy spoke again: I see that the people of the lower world suffer many misfortunes, harmed by malevolent spirits. For the sake of your deceased ancestors, parents, and honored kin, on the five La days—when heaven and earth grant amnesty—you should establish vegetarian feasts and Daoist rites, perform the Dao, offer reverent repentance, and submit petitions to rescue and deliver the deceased, that they may all attain liberation.

On the first day of the first month, the Heavenly La day, the Five Emperor Divine Immortals gather in the Azure Dragon Gate of the Peaceful Treasure Flower Grove in the Azure Heaven to review the records of human sins and blessings.
On the fifth day of the fifth month, the Earthly La day, the Five Emperor Divine Immortals gather in the Cinnabar Heaven at the Brahma Treasure Prosperous Cinnabar Terrace Gate to review the records of human sins and blessings.
On the seventh day of the seventh month, the Daoist La day, the Five Emperor Divine Immortals gather in the Golden Gate of the Plain Heaven at the Plain Spirit Gate to review the records of human sins and blessings.
On the first day of the tenth month, the People’s Year La day, the Five Emperor Divine Immortals gather in the Dark Gate of the Mysterious Heaven at the Black Spirit Gate of the Cavernous Yin to review the records of human sins and blessings.
On the La day in the twelfth month, the Royal La day, the Five Emperor Divine Immortals gather in the Mysterious Capital Jade Capital of the Primordial Spirit at the Wuji Metal Gate of the Primordial Origin in the Eightfold Radiance Hall of the Primordial Beginning to review the records of human sins and blessings.

These days are all occasions for assembling and determining the registers of good and ill fortune, life and death—all pertaining to the living.

On this day, the Nine Generations of ancestors—parents, spirits of the dark prisons, and wandering ghosts—are summoned by the Northern Emperor of Fengdu for interrogation. Long confined in the nether realms, their sins accumulated over ages, their offenses entangled with the names of descendants and the locations of ancestral tombs. If, after kalpas of time, no redemption has been sought, the living are implicated on this day: the names of descendants, kin, and the nine clans are called forth, their sins recorded as the living’s transgressions, their offenses bound to the Dark Capital, the nine clans doomed to annihilation.

On this day, one may submit petitions for deceased parents, offering repentance and supplication for their deliverance, that each departed soul may receive relief. Ordinary sacrifices cannot reach them, for Fengdu’s depths are too profound, its barriers too impassable. Only through the true Dao may their long-standing transgressions be absolved, for the nether officials do not wish to detain them indefinitely. Prolonged confinement of the dead incurs reproach from the celestial courts, and the officials of the dark realms are likewise held accountable. Thus, the living’s fortune turns to misfortune, and calamity arises therefrom. Yet if filial sons and daughters observe this day with fasting and rites, the names in the Black Registers are erased, and all may attain transcendence.

Today, the master of this repentance ritual, [Name], dedicates the merit, invoking the Perfected Immortals of the Lower Prime’s Water Realm, paying homage to the divine, surrendering body and life, to the Great Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy:
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who responds to devotion and follows karmic conditions.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who cultivates ascetic practice and accumulates merit.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who sees through all without attachment.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who answers distress with grace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Sun and Moon’s radiance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy free from stagnation and form.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who transforms and liberates without limit.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of constant compassion and mercy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Dharma Body.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy whose Dharma Body pervades all.

Having recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies above, we beseech repentance for [Name], from beginningless time until this day, for the six relations and kin of both the living and the dead, for the karmic causes of rebirth through the Six Paths, for the four modes of birth, ceaselessly taking form, unrestrained in the three karmas, indulging the six senses—killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, greed, delusion, anger, harsh speech, divisive words, falsehood, frivolous talk, disbelief in causality, failure to practice expedient means, betraying heaven and earth, breaking fasts and precepts, deceiving outsiders, scheming against masters, casting curses, summoning ghosts and spirits, neglecting the four kinds of life, unmindful of a single breath—each thought a transgression, each deed a fault. All these sins reside within the body, with no means of absolution. Some fall into hell, others become beasts; without encountering sacred scriptures, how can they attain liberation? Such offenses are boundless. Today, with utmost devotion, we repent them all, then dedicate the merit, invoking the Perfected Immortals of the Lower Prime’s Water Realm, paying homage to the divine, surrendering body and life, to the Great Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy:

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure’s Imperial Heaven.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Mystic Truth and Myriad Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme Mystery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mystic Upper Jade Palace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who delivers immortals and sagely beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who cherishes life and delivers beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Numinous Void.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Great Flower.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Void’s Luminous Sovereign.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the True Sovereign’s Mystic Spirit.

Having recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies above, we beseech repentance for all manner of sins. Prostrate, we implore the Compassionate Worthies of the Three Realms, the Perfected Saints of the Ten Directions, the Great Emperors of the Three Primes, the Five Venerable Elders, the One Hundred Twenty Bureaus, the Seventy-Two Courts, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, the Eight Seas and Nine Rivers, the Twelve River Sources, and all Perfected Immortals—to universally extend salvation, to manifest great compassion, to unfurl the clouds of the Dharma, to scatter the rain of the Dharma, to dispel burning afflictions, to wash away transgressions and faults, to instantly bring coolness, to clarify like clouds dispersed, to accumulate blessings for the living, to elevate the departed, to secure the nation and enrich the people, to rejoice in great peace, to fulfill merit and perfect virtue, to awaken to the Dao in every life, to hear the scriptures in every generation, that all sentient beings may ascend to the Dao’s shore.

Thus concludes the *Lower Scroll of the Supreme Compassionate Repentance Ritual for the Elimination of Sins through the Water Rites*.

chunks.original_text: 太上慈悲道场灭罪水忏 经名：太上慈悲道场灭罪水忏。 三卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部威仪类。 太上慈悲道场灭罪水忏卷上 尔时，元始天尊在大罗天上，玉京金阙紫微天台，大会群仙，敷扬妙法，救度天人，咸使悟道，不历诸苦，施大威力，放大光明，普照万国。 一切罪福，俱在目前，甚深微妙，方便开度，一切地狱穷魂，苦毒无量，痛楚难言，并蒙救拔，不溺沈沦，咸得超度。 是时，元始慈尊慈悲广演，更开要道，使过去未来，俱沾利益。 再告左右侍真曰，人之禀生，同资一气，及乎诞育，命系三元，夭寿吉凶，富贵贫贱，因缘罪福，善恶生死，各逐夙命根源，悉有报应，随其业力，永不差殊，如影随形，似声应谷。 每年三元之日、三元官属与三界十方、四司五帝、善恶童子、一切灵官，上朝金阙元始御前，考校男女生死之籍、罪福因缘及九幽地狱水府、穷魂姓名业簿。 此时，若有善信男女，能发自然道意，建造紫微宝台、玉京宝山、楼阁台榭、百宝妆严，香花供养，烧香行道，吟咏洞章，然灯放生，步虚法事，布施发愿，谢过上章，大建斋醮，虔告天地，昼夜不怠者，吾当遣十方天尊真人、诸天神仙、三界四司、救苦灵童，下降人间，齐到道场，为其灭罪，保佑生人。 使国土安宁，男女欢泰，众善齐降，诸恶不生。 地狱苦魂，一时解脱，竟生天上，快乐无为，功德巍巍，获福无量。 慈尊言，正月十五日，上元天官、主录百司上诣天阙，进呈世人罪福之籍。 今日道场忏主某是故回向，上元天界一切高真，皈依皈神，皈身皈命，大慈大悲无上天尊。 至心朝礼，玉清元始天尊。 至心朝礼，福生无量天尊。 至心朝礼，消灾解厄天尊。 至心朝礼，延寿益算天尊。 至心朝礼，长生保命天尊。 至心朝礼，紫清降福天尊。 至心朝礼，八卦护身天尊。 至心朝礼，九宫捍厄天尊。 至心朝礼，高真妙果天尊。 至心朝礼，十方灵宝天尊。 从此已上，礼念天尊圣号。 乞忏某自从无始以来，至於今日二师资父母、六亲眷属，三业所为，六根所造。 是故身贪细滑，意起虚妄，眼观恶色，耳听邪音，鼻好恶香，舌贪滋味，心生嫉妬，口出秽言。 如是等罪，无量无边。 今日虔诚，咸乞忏悔。 次复回向，上元天界一切高真，皈依皈神，皈身皈命，大慈大悲无上天尊。 至心朝礼，青灵始老天尊。 至心朝礼，丹灵真老天尊。 至心朝礼，皓灵皇老天尊。 至心朝礼，五灵玄老天尊。 至心朝礼，玄灵元老天尊。 至心朝礼，严净法惠天尊。 至心朝礼，应感威力天尊。 至心朝礼，无畏梵形天尊。 至心朝礼，大智惠海天尊。 至心朝礼，无量法藏天尊。 从此已上，礼念天尊圣号。 乞忏某自从无始以来，至於今日，师资父母、六亲眷属，无量无边杀生之罪。 或杀猪羊牛马、鸡犬鹅鸭。 或杀飞禽走兽、水族鱼鳞、蠢动含灵、一切物命。 或扶持疾病、淫祀鬼神、杀害众生。 或游猎好戏、耕田掘地、养蚕煮茧、放火放水、烧粪扫地、杀害众生。 或饮酒食肉。 或作酱鲊、焚樵露灯、热汤泼地、杀害众生。 或生分子母、断其胎育。 或杀胎卵。 或杀众生命无头数。 或杀债主冤家、四方良善。 或因争竞欺妬、攘取劫夺杀害。 或因征战谗佞、方便杀害。

**The Supreme Compassionate Dao-Field Rite of the Water Repentance for the Extinction of Sins**

**Title:** *The Supreme Compassionate Dao-Field Rite of the Water Repentance for the Extinction of Sins*
**Three fascicles.**
**Source text:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongxuan* Section, *Weiyi* Category.

---

**The Supreme Compassionate Dao-Field Rite of the Water Repentance for the Extinction of Sins, Fascicle One**

At that time, the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Origin resided in the Great Luo Heaven, upon the Purple Tenuity Terrace of the Jade Capital and Golden Tower. There, a grand assembly of immortals was convened, where the wondrous Dharma was expounded to deliver and enlighten both gods and humans, guiding them to awaken to the Dao without enduring manifold sufferings. Manifesting great majestic power and radiating boundless luminosity, the light illumined all ten thousand realms.

All sins and blessings stood plainly before them, profound and subtly wondrous. Through expedient means, all the destitute souls of the hells—enduring immeasurable agonies and inexpressible torments—were delivered, rescued from drowning in the depths, and universally liberated.

Then, the Merciful Honored One of the Origin, in boundless compassion, further expounded the essential Dao, bestowing benefits upon both past and future. Again, he addressed the perfected attendants at his side, saying:

"Humans receive life, all endowed with the same qi. Yet upon birth, their fate is bound to the Three Origins. Longevity or premature death, fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty, nobility or lowliness—all arise from the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, good and evil, life and death. Each follows the root of their former existence, and all receive retribution according to their karmic deeds, never deviating, as the shadow follows the form or the echo responds to the valley.

On the Three Origin Days each year, the officials of the Three Origins, along with the deities of the Three Realms and the Ten Directions, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the spirits of good and evil, and all numinous officials ascend to the Golden Tower before the Primordial Celestial Worthy to examine the registers of life and death for men and women, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing, and the ledgers of names and deeds of the destitute souls in the Nine Dark Hells, the Water Palaces, and other realms.

At this time, if there are faithful men and women who naturally awaken to the Dao, erecting Purple Tenuity Treasure Terraces, Jade Capital Treasure Mountains, pavilions and towers adorned with a hundred treasures, offering incense and flowers, burning incense and circumambulating, chanting cavernous scriptures, lighting lamps and releasing living beings, performing the *Step-of-Emptiness* rites, practicing almsgiving and making vows, repenting transgressions and submitting memorials, holding grand fasts and jiao offerings, and devoutly petitioning Heaven and Earth day and night without ceasing—then I shall dispatch the Celestial Worthies and Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions, the divine immortals of the Three Realms, the Four Controllers, and the Youths Who Save from Suffering to descend to the human realm, all arriving at the Dao-field to extinguish their sins and protect the living.

Thus shall the lands be peaceful, men and women joyous and at ease, all blessings descend, and all evils cease to arise. The suffering souls of hell shall be liberated in an instant, reborn in the heavens to enjoy boundless bliss, their merit towering and their blessings immeasurable."

The Merciful Honored One continued: "On the fifteenth day of the first month, the Celestial Official of the Upper Origin and the Recording Officials of the Hundred Bureaus ascend to the celestial palaces to present the registers of sin and blessing for the world’s people."

For this reason, the sponsor of this repentance rite now dedicates the merit, reverently prostrating to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Origin Heaven, taking refuge in the spirit, body, and life, and paying homage to the supremely merciful and compassionate Celestial Worthy beyond compare.

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Jade Purity Primordial Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Bestows Boundless Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Dispels Disasters and Resolves Calamities.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Prolongs Life and Increases Longevity.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy Who Preserves Life and Protects Destiny.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Purple Purity Celestial Worthy Who Descends Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Eight Trigrams Who Guards the Body.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Nine Palaces Who Defends Against Calamities.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Lofty Perfection and Wondrous Fruition.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Numinous Treasure Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions.

Having thus paid homage to the sacred titles of the Celestial Worthies above, we now repent:

From beginningless time until this day, for myself, my teachers, preceptors, parents, and the six relations, for all transgressions committed through the three karmic actions and the six senses—
Thus has the body craved softness and smoothness, the mind given rise to false imaginings, the eyes beheld evil forms, the ears listened to perverse sounds, the nose favored foul odors, the tongue coveted rich flavors, the heart harbored jealousy, and the mouth uttered defiled speech.
Such sins as these are boundless and immeasurable.
Today, with utmost sincerity, we earnestly repent them all.

Next, we dedicate the merit, reverently prostrating to all the lofty perfected ones of the Upper Origin Heaven, taking refuge in the spirit, body, and life, and paying homage to the supremely merciful and compassionate Celestial Worthy beyond compare.

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Azure Numinous Primordial Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Cinnabar Numinous Perfected Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Luminous August Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Five Numinous Mysterious Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Mysterious Numinous Primordial Elder Celestial Worthy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Solemn Purity and Dharma Wisdom.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Responsive Power and Might.

We earnestly repent all such sins.

Perhaps I have lightly esteemed the Three Treasures, my devotion lacking constancy. Perhaps I have betrayed my teachers and preceptors, violating vows and breaking covenants. Perhaps I have been disloyal to my sovereign, unyielding to the times, failing to honor the Great Dao, or treating its teachings with contempt. Perhaps I have defiled rivers and streams, dredged the hundred waterways, taken fish and scales to satisfy my palate. Perhaps I have acted without shame or remorse, disdaining clothing and food, wasting the five grains, cursing oxen and horses, harming silkworms and moths, or neglecting agriculture and sericulture. Perhaps I have seen profit and forgotten righteousness, lacking integrity and honor, favoring the new while abandoning the old, or knowing kindness yet failing to repay it.

Such boundless and measureless transgressions as these I now devoutly confess and repent in their entirety. Next, I dedicate this merit to all the immortals and sages of the Lower Primordial Water Realm, taking refuge in the divine, taking refuge in the spirit, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life—O Most Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of unparalleled honor and wonder.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who bestows grace from the Jade Capital.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who saves through the treasure of adaptable power.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the radiant Brahma-light of the Great Tenuity.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose true form is perfectly fulfilled.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of supreme and unconditioned victory.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of tranquil harmony and pure joy.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of serene non-attainment.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of the unfathomable dark source.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of silent contemplation and non-action.

From this point onward, I reverently recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.

I beseech forgiveness for all my transgressions from beginningless time until this day—those committed against the living and the dead, the Daoist and the secular, for failing to reflect on the toil and suffering of my parents, repaying none of their nurturing care: the ten months of pregnancy, three years of breastfeeding, turning dry for wet, swallowing bitterness to spit out sweetness, washing and tending, their boundless love and concern—only to commit the five heinous acts of filial impiety in return. Perhaps as son or daughter, for the sake of qi or wealth, I have indulged in wine and lust, entangled in enmity and curses, implicating my parents in endless resentment. Perhaps in building homes or graves, I have violated many taboos, filling the measure of my sins to overflowing, inviting calamity to flow forth. Perhaps my retribution has come through lawsuits and summons, my deceased ancestors drawn into the fray. Perhaps my fate has grown weak and perilous, malevolent stars traversing my path, manifesting in this life as various karmic flowers, while in hell, they ripen into various karmic fruits.

The Merciful Worthy declares: Such retributions for the body in this life all stem from sins committed in past lives. After death, one passes through hell, and in the next life, suffers retribution across the six paths, endlessly revolving in the wheel of rebirth.

Today, I devoutly confess and repent of all these transgressions in their entirety. Next, I dedicate this merit to all the immortals and sages of the Lower Primordial Water Realm, taking refuge in the divine, taking refuge in the spirit, taking refuge in the body, taking refuge in life—O Most Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose merit and deeds are boundless.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy whose Dharma rain pours abundantly.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of vast and perfect fulfillment.

With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy who adapts to impermanence.
With utmost sincerity, I bow and worship the Heavenly Worthy of vast compassion and magnanimity.

From this point onward, I reverently recite the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies.

I beseech forgiveness for all my transgressions from beginningless time until this day.

Then the Merciful Worthy spoke again: I see that the people of the lower world suffer many misfortunes, harmed by malevolent spirits. For the sake of your deceased ancestors, parents, and honored kin, on the five La days—when heaven and earth grant amnesty—you should establish vegetarian feasts and Daoist rites, perform the Dao, offer reverent repentance, and submit petitions to rescue and deliver the deceased, that they may all attain liberation.

chunks.original_text: 九祖父母，幽狱鬼魂，此日为酆都北帝引出责问。 久处阴司，年代积远，罪结衅由，端及子孙姓名，坟墓所在。 如积劫未有追赎，因此日延累生人，引问子孙亲姻、九族姓名，为生人罪状，积衅幽都，九族延灭。 此日可为亡故父母，上表谢罪，忏悔追拔，皆令亡人一一得之。 常日祭祀，不可得达。 盖为酆都幽深，难为通彻，沐赖真猷，皆得宿愆解释，幽司不欲久滞。 死魂久滞，则天曹责及，幽司官吏亦责及，生人转福为祸，灾难自此而生。 若有至孝男女，此日修奉斋醮，则黑籍除名，皆得超度。 今日道场忏主某是故回向，下元水界一切仙哲，皈依皈神，皈身皈命，大慈大悲无上天尊。 至心朝礼，赴感随缘天尊。 至心朝礼，梵行修功天尊。 至心朝礼，洞鉴无得天尊。 至心朝礼，赴难垂恩天尊。 至心朝礼，日月光明天尊。 至心朝礼，无滞着相天尊。 至心朝礼，无方化度天尊。 至心朝礼，常慈爱怜天尊。 至心朝礼，无量法身天尊。 至心朝礼，周应法身天尊。 从此已上，礼念天尊圣号。 乞忏某自从无始以来，至於今日，六亲眷属，存亡二世，轮回六道因缘，四生舍身，不闲不歇，优饶三业，恣纵六情，杀盗邪淫，贪痴嗔怒，恶口两舌，妄言绮语，不信因缘，不行方便，辜天负地，破斋犯戒，情故外人，返谋师父，为冤结咒，引鬼牵神，不念四生，岂思一息，种种为报，念念成非。 总在身中，无由雪释。 或堕地狱，或为畜生，不值圣文，何能超度。 如是等罪，无量无边，今日虔诚，咸乞忏悔，次复回向，下元水界一切仙哲，皈依皈神，皈身皈命，大慈大悲无上天尊。 至心朝礼，玉宝皇上天尊。 至心朝礼，玄真万福天尊。 至心朝礼，太妙至极天尊。 至心朝礼，玄上玉宸天尊。 至心朝礼，度仙上圣天尊。 至心朝礼，好生度命天尊。 至心朝礼，太灵虚皇天尊。 至心朝礼，无量太华天尊。 至心朝礼，玉虚明皇天尊。 至心朝礼，真皇洞神天尊。 从此已上，礼念天尊圣号。 乞忏某种种罪业。 伏乞三境慈尊、十方至圣、三元大帝、五老高真、一百二十曹、七十二府、四司五帝、八海九江、十二河源、一切仙哲，普开救度，大设慈悲，垂大法云，散大法雨，消除热恼，洗涤愆非，顿尔清凉，了然云净，见存积庆，已往超升。 国安民丰，欢乐太平，功满德就，生生悟道，世世闻经，一切有情，咸跻道岸。 太上慈悲道场灭罪水忏卷下竟

On this day, the Nine Generations of ancestors—parents, spirits of the dark prisons, and wandering ghosts—are summoned by the Northern Emperor of Fengdu for interrogation. Long confined in the nether realms, their sins accumulated over ages, their offenses entangled with the names of descendants and the locations of ancestral tombs. If, after kalpas of time, no redemption has been sought, the living are implicated on this day: the names of descendants, kin, and the nine clans are called forth, their sins recorded as the living’s transgressions, their offenses bound to the Dark Capital, the nine clans doomed to annihilation.

On this day, one may submit petitions for deceased parents, offering repentance and supplication for their deliverance, that each departed soul may receive relief. Ordinary sacrifices cannot reach them, for Fengdu’s depths are too profound, its barriers too impassable. Only through the true Dao may their long-standing transgressions be absolved, for the nether officials do not wish to detain them indefinitely. Prolonged confinement of the dead incurs reproach from the celestial courts, and the officials of the dark realms are likewise held accountable. Thus, the living’s fortune turns to misfortune, and calamity arises therefrom. Yet if filial sons and daughters observe this day with fasting and rites, the names in the Black Registers are erased, and all may attain transcendence.

Today, the master of this repentance ritual, [Name], dedicates the merit, invoking the Perfected Immortals of the Lower Prime’s Water Realm, paying homage to the divine, surrendering body and life, to the Great Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy:
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who responds to devotion and follows karmic conditions.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who cultivates ascetic practice and accumulates merit.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who sees through all without attachment.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who answers distress with grace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Sun and Moon’s radiance.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy free from stagnation and form.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who transforms and liberates without limit.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of constant compassion and mercy.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Dharma Body.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy whose Dharma Body pervades all.

Having recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies above, we beseech repentance for [Name], from beginningless time until this day, for the six relations and kin of both the living and the dead, for the karmic causes of rebirth through the Six Paths, for the four modes of birth, ceaselessly taking form, unrestrained in the three karmas, indulging the six senses—killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, greed, delusion, anger, harsh speech, divisive words, falsehood, frivolous talk, disbelief in causality, failure to practice expedient means, betraying heaven and earth, breaking fasts and precepts, deceiving outsiders, scheming against masters, casting curses, summoning ghosts and spirits, neglecting the four kinds of life, unmindful of a single breath—each thought a transgression, each deed a fault. All these sins reside within the body, with no means of absolution. Some fall into hell, others become beasts; without encountering sacred scriptures, how can they attain liberation? Such offenses are boundless. Today, with utmost devotion, we repent them all, then dedicate the merit, invoking the Perfected Immortals of the Lower Prime’s Water Realm, paying homage to the divine, surrendering body and life, to the Great Compassionate and Merciful Supreme Heavenly Worthy:

With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Treasure’s Imperial Heaven.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Mystic Truth and Myriad Blessings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Supreme Mystery.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mystic Upper Jade Palace.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who delivers immortals and sagely beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy who cherishes life and delivers beings.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Numinous Void.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Boundless Great Flower.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Void’s Luminous Sovereign.
With utmost sincerity, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the True Sovereign’s Mystic Spirit.

Having recited the sacred titles of the Heavenly Worthies above, we beseech repentance for all manner of sins. Prostrate, we implore the Compassionate Worthies of the Three Realms, the Perfected Saints of the Ten Directions, the Great Emperors of the Three Primes, the Five Venerable Elders, the One Hundred Twenty Bureaus, the Seventy-Two Courts, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, the Eight Seas and Nine Rivers, the Twelve River Sources, and all Perfected Immortals—to universally extend salvation, to manifest great compassion, to unfurl the clouds of the Dharma, to scatter the rain of the Dharma, to dispel burning afflictions, to wash away transgressions and faults, to instantly bring coolness, to clarify like clouds dispersed, to accumulate blessings for the living, to elevate the departed, to secure the nation and enrich the people, to rejoice in great peace, to fulfill merit and perfect virtue, to awaken to the Dao in every life, to hear the scriptures in every generation, that all sentient beings may ascend to the Dao’s shore.

Thus concludes the *Lower Scroll of the Supreme Compassionate Repentance Ritual for the Elimination of Sins through the Water Rites*.
